pullrequest.title: Pose frame semantics: Suggested semantics to handle maximal coordinates

content.raw:
I think it would be useful if the meaning of `pose[@frame]` is consistent across the board. Right now, it means "affixed_to" in `//model/frame/pose[@frame]` but means "expressed w.r.t" (and NOT affixed to) in `//link/frame[@frame]`, `/model/pose[@frame]`, `//link/pose[@frame]`, and `//include/pose[@frame]`. My suggestion would be to removed the "affixed_to" semantics from the pose tag and put it in the frame tag with an extra attribute. For example we can do:

```xml
<model name="M">
  <frame name="F1" affixed_to="L1">
     <pose frame="L1">{X_L1F1}</pose> <!-- Affixed to L1 and pose expressed w.r.t L1 -->
  </frame>
  <frame name="F2" affixed_to="L2">
     <pose>{X_MF2}</pose> <!-- Affixed to L2 but pose expressed w.r.t M -->
  </frame>
  
  <link name="L1"/>
   <link name="L2"/>
</model>
```

I realize there is an exception with `//link/frame` in that it can't have an `affixed_to` attribute, but, in my mind, that's easier to reason about and remember.
